intro: Oubanguia alata, commonly known as the African sarsaparilla, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, followed by red, fleshy berries. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Oubanguia alata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
